I see several issues here

sliceInputRetainedSizeInBytes was already counted on line 91. For the no compression case, counting the buffer size here is double counting.
setBytes() should be counting all retained memory for this object, but here you're only counting buffer. It is just one part of the memory used by OrcInputStream object. Other parts include instance size, temporaryBuffer size, compressedSliceInput but these are not counted.

timeline.message:
Shrink cached buffers in OrcInputStream

Shrink cached buffers in OrcInputStream to avoid unnecesary memory overhead

Cached buffers tend to expand over time and retain extra memory.
In the situation when the number of ORC streams is high and the data
is very unevenly distributed the overhead of retaining overly expanded buffer
can be very high

Reuse decompression buffer between multiple OrcInputStream's

Multiple instances of an OrcInputStream can share the same decompression
buffer when reading a stripe, as the streams are always read serially
